cluster_relations.rel_desc: Gestures are described as an aspect or component of body language.
remarks: Direction set from gestures to body language as part-to-whole.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Facial expressions are implicitly framed as one aspect of body language, with gestures being 'another' aspect.
remarks: Relation partly inferred from discourse structure; semantics match standard definition of body language.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Posture is identified as a key component of body language.
Gestures are a type of nonverbal behavior that functions as part of body language.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: TypeOfNonverbal: gestures as part of body language

remarks: Relation inferred from conceptual grouping; text implies gestures are within body language.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Touching is given as an example or component of romantic body language.
Gazing is an example or component of romantic body language.
Mirroring gestures are examples or components of romantic body language.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.
args.justification: All relations describe a consistent part-to-whole or example-to-category composition: specific nonverbal behaviors (gestures, facial expressions, posture, touching, gazing, mirroring gestures) are described as aspects or components of broader constructs (body language or romantic body language). Normalizing to a single predicate 'is_component_of' removes minor wording differences like 'part_of' vs 'is_component_of' while preserving the same directional semantics.

Each relation links a more specific behavior to a broader construct in a clear part-to-whole fashion (component within a system or category). A generic class 'component_whole_relation' captures this structural semantics and can be reused beyond nonverbal communication.
All relations describe compositional structure where the subject contributes to the makeup of the object as a larger whole or category, which is prototypical COMPOSITION semantics.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a component, aspect, or example of the object, which represents a larger whole, system, or category.
executed_decisions.justification: All relations describe a consistent part-to-whole or example-to-category composition: specific nonverbal behaviors (gestures, facial expressions, posture, touching, gazing, mirroring gestures) are described as aspects or components of broader constructs (body language or romantic body language). Normalizing to a single predicate 'is_component_of' removes minor wording differences like 'part_of' vs 'is_component_of' while preserving the same directional semantics.

Each relation links a more specific behavior to a broader construct in a clear part-to-whole fashion (component within a system or category). A generic class 'component_whole_relation' captures this structural semantics and can be reused beyond nonverbal communication.
All relations describe compositional structure where the subject contributes to the makeup of the object as a larger whole or category, which is prototypical COMPOSITION semantics.
